job title: Software Engineer - iOS/Mobile Development - Global Equity Technology
job description:
Job Description:

* Candidates Requiring VISA sponsorship will not be considered for this role *

This position is for a Fulltime Employee to be located onsite in Plano, TX offices only, No remote option, C2C or contract roles

Mobile developer to work across all layers of rich client, Full stack Roadshow Application Automation and web applications for Sales CRM Application in the Global Markets Technology Space. At least 8+ years of work experience

Responsibilities:
  • Design and development of beautiful, usable and functionally rich iOS apps
  • Provide technical leadership to an iOS development project team
  • Guide architectural decisions and technical designs
  • Investigate technical feasibility and suggest implementation options
  • Work closely with stakeholders (product owners, UX designers, project managers) and other development team members
  • Work on and guide the refactoring of existing code
  • Hands-on iOS app development, including feature development, troubleshooting, debugging, problem solving and bug fixing
  • Design and run your own unit test cases and integrate your code as part of a Continuous Integration process
  • Working within an Agile environments
Required Skills:

Qualified candidates must have the following:
  • 5 - 6+ years of software development experience
  • 3+ years of experience with mobile applications (iPhone, Android, Windows Mobile)
  • 2+ years of experience with Swift
  • Experience with object-oriented design principles (Objective-C, C#, C++, or Java)
  • Must have understanding of major mobile Design & Development paradigms spanning User Experience (native, HTML 5/Webkit), data ingestion, analytics, web services (REST & JSON), etc.
  • Strong interpersonal skills, written and verbal communication
  • Strong problem solving, critical thinking, and testing skills
  • Experience working in an Agile or Scrum environment
  • Candidates Requiring VISA sponsorship will not be considered for this role
Shift:

1st shift (United States of America)

Hours Per Week:

40
